Package gui

Class StateWinning

java.lang.Object
gui.StateWinning
All Implemented Interfaces:
State
public class StateWinning extends Object implements State
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the final stage where the user sees the final screen and can restart the game. This class is part of a state pattern for the Controller class. It is a ConcreteState. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener in Control and then handed over with the handleUserInput method. Responsibilities Show the final screen Accept input of any kind to return to title screen This code contains refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(Control control, MazePanel panel, boolean robotUsed, Robot robot)
      Start the game by showing the final screen with a winning message.
      Parameters:
      controller - needed to be able to switch states, must be not null
      panel - is the UI entity to produce the screen on

    • handleUserInput

      public boolean handleUserInput​(Constants.UserInput userInput, int value)
      The method provides an appropriate response to user keyboard input. The control calls this method to communicate input and delegate its handling. Method requires start to be called before. Regardless of input, the response is to switch to the title screen.
      Specified by:
      handleUserInput in interface State
      Parameters:
      userInput - is not used in this state, exists only for consistency across State classes
      value - is not used in this state, exists only for consistency across State classes
      Returns:
      true if handled, false if input comes before start was called

    • switchToTitle

      public void switchToTitle()
      Switches the controller to the initial screen.

    • setPathLength

      public void setPathLength​(int pathLength)
      Sets the path length.
      Parameters:
      pathLength - the number of steps the player did from starting to exit position

    • start

      public void start​(Control control, MazePanel panel)
      Description copied from interface: State
      Starts the main operation to be performed in this state. Semantics depends on the particular state implementing it. This is polymorphism in action.
      Specified by:
      start in interface State
      Parameters:
      control - is a reference to the current controller
      panel - is the panel to draw graphics on
